content.question: A large factory that builds machines has three shifts, one that starts at 4:00 A.M., one that starts at noon, and one that starts at 8:00 P.M. The manager of the factory wanted to know whether there is an association between an employee’s work experience (less than five years with the company, between five and twenty years with the company, over twenty years with the company) and the time of the employee’s shift. The manager selected a random sample of 125 employees and classified employees by their shift time and work experience. Which of the following is an appropriate pair of hypotheses for the manager to use?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Work experience is independent of the time of an employee’s shift.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Work experience is dependent on the time of an employee’s shift.

<math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Employees with over 20 years of experience are just as likely to start work at 8 P.M.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Employees with over 20 years of experience are less likely to start work at 8 P.M.

<math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> There is an association between work experience and an employee’s shift.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> There is no association between work experience and an employee’s shift.

<math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> For each shift, there is no difference between the proportions of work experience level.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> For each shift, there is a difference between the proportions of work experience level.

<math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Among those in the sample, the proportion of employees for each work experience level did not differ by shift.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Among those in the sample, the proportion of employees for each work experience level did differ by shift.

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Work experience is independent of the time of an employee’s shift.<math alttext="H sub a:" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></msub><mtext> </mtext><mo>:</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Work experience is dependent on the time of an employee’s shift.

topic.text: 8.5: Setting Up a Chi-Square Test for Homogeneity or Independence

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
